Helper¶

helper.help_agent.character_mapping(character: str) → dict¶

Maps a character type to its corresponding attributes.

Parameters:

character (str) – The character type to map.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the attributes associated with the specified character type or defaults.

Return type:

dict

helper.help_agent.set_mind(agent, other_attrs=None) → None¶

Sets the attributes of the agent based on the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

other_attrs (dict, optional) – A dictionary of attribute names and values to set. If None, no attributes are set. Defaults to None.

helper.help_conversation.draw_max_from_list(random: dict, list: list, type: str)¶

Draws a random index of the maximum value from a list. Used for drawing a single topic or listener.

Parameters:

  • random (dict) – A random number generator.

  • list (list) – A list of numerical values from which to find the maximum.

  • type (str) – A key from the simulation’s random dict (e.g., “topic”).

Returns:

The index of the maximum value in the list. If there are multiple maximum values, a random index among them is returned.

Return type:

int

helper.help_main.make_outfile_name(character)¶

Generate the output file name based on character configuration and simulation parameters.

Parameters:

character (dict) – Dictionary with {agent_id: character, …}. The key ‘all’ may be used as a special case.

Returns:

The complete file path where the simulation output will be saved.

Return type:

str

helper.help_main.parse_arguments()¶

Parse command-line arguments for the simulation script.

Returns:

Parsed arguments containing flags for run, plot and override.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

helper.help_main.save_data_as_json(data, filename)¶

Save simulation data as a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to save in JSON format.

  • filename (str) – The output file name for the saved JSON data.

helper.help_plotter.create_button(label: str, func: Callable, layout, row: int = None, col: int = None) → QPushButton¶

Creates a QPushButton widget with a given label.

Parameters:

  • label (str) – The text to display on the button.

  • func (Callable) – The function to call when the button is clicked.

  • layout (QLayout) – The layout to which the button will be added.

  • row (int, optional) – The row in the layout where the button will be placed.

  • col (int, optional) – The column in the layout where the button will be placed.

Returns:

The created button widget.

Return type:

QPushButton

helper.help_plotter.create_label(text: str, row: int, col: int, layout) → None¶

Creates a QLabel widget with the given text.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The text to display on the label.

  • row (int) – The row in the layout where the label will be placed.

  • col (int) – The column in the layout where the label will be placed.

  • layout (QLayout) – The layout to which the label will be added.

helper.help_plotter.create_select(items, row: int, col: int, layout, func=None) → QComboBox¶

Creates a QComboBox widget with given items.

Parameters:

  • items (list) – A list of items to add to the combo box.

  • row (int) – The row in the layout where the combo box will be placed.

  • col (int) – The column in the layout where the combo box will be placed.

  • layout (QLayout) – The layout to which the combo box will be added.

  • func (Callable, optional) – An optional function to connect to the currentTextChanged signal.

Returns:

The created combo box widget.

Return type:

QComboBox

helper.help_plotter.update_plot(func: Callable) → Callable¶

Decorator to update the plot after the function execution.

helper.help_simulation.make_random_dict(simulation_seed: int) → dict¶

Generate a dictionary of seeded random number generators based on the configuration and seed variation. Used throughout the simulation to make “random” decisions.

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – A dictionary containing the base configuration, including a “seed” value.

  • simulation_seed (int) – An integer used to vary the seeds for different categories.

Returns:

A dictionary where each key corresponds to a specific category, and each value is a seeded RandomState object.

Return type:

dict

helper.run_parallel.batch_tasks(tasks: list, batch_size: int) → list[list]¶

Divide tasks into batches of specified size.

Parameters:

  • tasks (list) – A list of tasks to be batched.

  • batch_size (int) – The maximum size of each batch.

Returns:

A list of batches, where each batch is a list of tasks.

Return type:

list[list]

helper.run_parallel.launch_parallel(tasks: list, task_fn) → list¶

Launch tasks in parallel using multiple cores.

Parameters:

  • tasks (list) – A list of tasks to be processed.

  • task_fn – A function that defines the task to be executed on each item.

Returns:

A list of results from the processed tasks.

Return type:

list

helper.run_parallel.process_batch(batch: list, task_fn) → list¶

Process a single batch of tasks using the specified function. Feed multiple tasks at once to a core.

Parameters:

  • batch (list) – A list of tasks to be processed in this batch.

  • task_fn – A function that defines the task to be executed on each item.

Returns:

A list of results from processing the batch.

Return type:

list

helper.run_parallel.run_parallel(batches: list, task_fn, n_cores: int) → list¶

Execute batches of tasks in parallel.

Parameters:

  • batches (list) – A list of batches, each containing tasks.

  • task_fn – A function that defines the task to be executed on each item.

  • n_cores (int) – The number of CPU cores to use for parallel processing.

Returns:

A flattened list of results from all processed batches.

Return type:

list
